bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Payment out of BC Timber Sales Account
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 109 (3) (e) of the Forest Act, money in the BC Timber Sales Account may be expended for a purpose related to an agreement, between the government and a holder of a licence or agreement referred to in section 61 (1) of the Forest Act, respecting a reduction under that section of the allowable annual cut authorized in or for the licence or agreement to make timber available for disposition under

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a timber sales licence entered into under section 20 of the Forest Act,
a forestry licence to cut entered into under section 47.6 (3) of the Forest Act, or
a road permit granted for a licence referred to in paragraph (a) or (b) to the licence holder,

bcl:section.bcl:text: to persons other than the holder of the licence or agreement referred to in section 61 (1) of the Forest Act.

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Forest Act, R.S.B.C. 1996, c. 157, sections 109 (3) (e) and 151 (1)]
